title: OpenSSL is patching just its second critical security flaw ever
description: Patch for high-severity OpenSSL flaw is coming imminently, giving IT teams a little time to prepare.

title: Seagate set to cut thousands of jobs following difficult results
description: Seagate is set to lay off around 3,000 workers following a steep decline in profits.

title: Microsoft is finally cutting down on this list of dodgy Windows drivers
description: The HVCI list should be updated once or twice a year, Microsoft promises.

title: Christmas sales 2022: early deals from Amazon, Best Buy, Walmart and more
description: The 2022 Christmas sales event has arrived, and we have all the best deals on TVs, coffee makers, toys, vacuums and more.

title: Christmas sales 2022: when is it and what to expect
description: The 2022 Christmas sales event will be here before you know it, and our guide will have all the best deals from Amazon, Target, Walmart, and more.

title: Dropbox wants to cut down on the number of apps you use at work
description: Dropbox wants to keep its users contained within its own ecosystem with these new updates.

title: This huge typosquatting campaign is being used to run tech support scams
description: Scammers are getting people's phone numbers, and possibly even access to their bank accounts.

title: One of the best Modern Warfare 2 maps has been cut a day before launch
description: Modern Warfare 2’s progression overlook has landed, and we’re in for a huge launch day,even without the Museum map.

title: Xbox Game Pass is the focus of next year's Xbox Series X UI refresh
description: A new Xbox Series X|S home menu layout is available for Insiders, and it puts Xbox Game Pass front and center.

title: Mac and iOS security flaw could expose your Siri conversations – but there’s a fix
description: Here’s a good reason to update to the latest version of macOS or iOS if you use Bluetooth headphones and Siri.

title: Microsoft Teams is officially more popular than email for most businesses
description: Satya Nadella claims Microsoft Teams usage is up with enterprises everywhere even after the pandemic.

title: ExpressVPN privacy and server technology gets the OK from two new independent audits
description: ExpressVPN has received external validation regarding its privacy and server technology from KPMG and Cure53.

title: Dark Souls' biggest competitor is free for PS Plus subscribers this month
description: Nioh 2 is among the offerings for PlayStation Plus this November, and it’s still one of the best Soulslikes around.

title: This Microsoft Outlook for Web update could stop embarrassing email fails for good
description: Make your Outlook contact list much easier to navigate with this new update.

title: NVIDIA GeForce NOW: upgrade your gaming performance without buying new hardware
description: NVIDIA’s GeForce NOW is a cost-effective way to upgrade your gaming experience without needing to pay for any new hardware, and there’s a special discount available to try it out now.

title: It looks like Street Fighter 6 is launching much later than we thought
description: Capcom's half-year report has Street Fighter 6 fans worried, with a single "major new title" launching in 2023's second half.

title: Ryzen 3 7300X leak gives us hope that AMD is planning a Zen 4 budget CPU
description: Are we finally getting a Ryzen 3 CPU for budget builds? Maybe, and it could come with a 10-core Ryzen 7 7800X.

title: Overclockers UK will let you stamp your designs on your next gaming chair
description: Overclockers UK will allow consumers to put their own branding or artwork on select gaming chairs.

title: Zoom and Google Meet are coming closer together at last
description: Google Meet announces a major change to the way users can connect - and no-one’s talking about it.

title: Nearly all of us are guilty of reusing passwords in the workplace
description: Nobody seems to care about unique, strong passwords, and that's a major security issue.

title: Nvidia wants a head start in the next GPU war, but it's still haunted by the RTX 4080
description: Nvidia goes on charm offensive after RTX 4080 12GB debacle, while also wooing TMSC for 3nm chips.

title: How web data is transforming ecommerce
description: The ecommerce field is changing fast, and data is the catalyst.

title: The Callisto Protocol is too violent for the Japanese ratings board
description: Excessive gore bars The Callisto Protocol from the Japanese market – but this has happened before.

title: EA has bad news for gamers who like physical games
description: EA has chosen to suspend the distribution of physical game copies in Germany, signaling an all-digital future.

title: Cabasse’s Rialto wireless speakers are a serious high-end soundbar alternative
description: The active stereo speaker pair nods to the brand’s spherical ethos but in a more practical package.

title: Sony's best wireless earbuds are getting a great free upgrade soon
description: Sony will add multipoint Bluetooth audio support to its LinkBuds, LinkBuds S and WF-1000XM4 wireless earbuds.

title: Guardians of the Galaxy’s Disney Plus special joins the Xmas kidnap movie tradition
description: Christmas kidnappings is a weirdly common theme for movies, so the Guardians are joining a fine heritage.

title: Google Stadia is dead and Nvidia GeForce Now gets a price cut – what’s going on?
description: If you’ll soon enough be an ex-Google Stadia streamer, then Nvidia has a tempting offer for you.

title: The next iPad Pro could have a huge screen and an enormous price tag
description: A leaker claims Apple is working on a massive 16-inch iPad for release sometime in 2023.

title: We're all being hit with more cyberattacks than ever
description: Hackers are increasingly targeting the education industry, report finds.

title: Meta says the Oculus Quest 3 will launch “next year”
description: Meta has revealed in an earnings call that its Oculus Quest 2 successor (the Oculus Quest 3) will launch "next year" in 2023.

title: The MCU has affected games like Silent Hill in a weird way
description: Konami announced an extensive roadmap for the future of Silent Hill and it may be a sign of things to come.

title: Sony's most comfortable wireless earbuds can now help to save the planet too
description: Sony's LinkBuds S wireless earbuds now come in a new Earth Blue version made from recycled water dispensers.
